p: Chronic enteropathies (CE) are common cause for persistent or recurrent gastrointestinal signs in dogs. Food‐responsive enteropathy (FRE), antimicrobial‐responsive enteropathy (ARE), and immunosuppressive‐responsive enteropathy (IRE) have different etiologies however clinical signs overlap and distinguishing among these disorders may be challenging with the most reliable diagnostic tool represented by sequential treatment using diet, antimicrobials, and immunosuppressive drugs.
